name: Trigonometric Substitution
explanation: Trigonometric substitution uses trigonometric identities to simplify integrals containing square roots of quadratic expressions. Common substitutions: for √(a² - x²), use x = a sin θ; for √(a² + x²), use x = a tan θ; for √(x² - a²), use x = a sec θ. This technique leverages the Pythagorean identity to eliminate square roots.
